perturbation.original_text: 1. The Principal appoints the Distributor as a non-exclusive distributor, to sell Principal's qPCR infectious disease kits, Logix Smart COVID-19 PCR diagnostic test and Co-Dx Box™ instrument (the "Products"). The Products are described on Exhibit A to this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: 1. The Principal appoints the Distributor as a non-exclusive distributor, to sell Principal's qPCR infectious disease kits, Logix Smart COVID-19 PCR diagnostic test and Co-Dx Box™ instrument (the "Products").
perturbation.explanation: By removing the reference to 'Exhibit A', the agreement no longer explicitly defines the Products. However, other clauses still refer to 'the Products', creating ambiguity. This creates uncertainty because without Exhibit A, there's no clear, agreed-upon list of products the distributor is authorized to sell, potentially leading to disputes.

perturbation.original_text: 9. Principal will grant Distributor a discount based on the Products and Prices. The proposed discount is expected to be ¨%. Discount may vary depending on product volume ordered or promotions.
perturbation.changed_text: 9. Principal will grant Distributor a discount. Discount may vary depending on product volume ordered or promotions.
perturbation.explanation: Removing the phrase "based on the Products and Prices" creates a contradiction. Later in the clause discounts are mentioned but there is no reference made to what the discounts are based on. This introduces a perturbation because it creates ambiguity as to how discount will be given.

perturbation.original_text: 11. In the event of termination, the Distributor shall be entitled to receive all orders accepted by the Principal prior to the date of termination and may sell the ordered Products in the Territory. Payment to be made upon shipment.
perturbation.changed_text: 11. In the event of termination, the Distributor shall be entitled to receive all orders accepted by the Principal prior to the date of termination and may sell the ordered Products in the Territory.
perturbation.explanation: By removing 'Payment to be made upon shipment,' the contract lacks a defined payment term upon termination. However, the distributor retains the right to sell Products, creating a contradiction in terms because it is uncertain when payments should be given upon termination if a Distributor sells products.
